meanings.sent1: I accidentally smooshed my sandwich in my bag.
meanings.sent2: She smooshed the playdough into a ball.
meanings.sent3: The cat smooshed itself into the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The heavy weight smooshed the cardboard flat.
meanings.sent5: The car tire smooshed the banana peel on the road.

meanings.sent1: He smooshed the toothpaste tube to get the last bit out.
meanings.sent2: The child smooshed the clay between their fingers.
meanings.sent3: She smooshed the stress ball to relieve tension.
meanings.sent4: The hug smooshed the air out of my lungs.
meanings.sent5: The chef smooshed the garlic with the back of a knife.

meanings.definition: To combine or mix something closely
meanings.sent1: She smooshed the colors together to create a new shade.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for smooshing the ingredients until well blended.
meanings.sent3: The kids smooshed the playdough colors into a rainbow mess.
meanings.sent4: The artist smooshed different textures onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The baker smooshed the butter and sugar for the cake batter.
